facts: Ludwig van Beethoven kept composing music even after he became almost completely deaf.
Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart began performing and writing music as a child and wrote more than 600 pieces in his short life.
Johann Sebastian Bach came from a large musical family and worked as a church musician for much of his career.
Antonio Vivaldi was nicknamed the "Red Priest" and is famous for a set of violin concertos called "The Four Seasons."
Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky wrote famous ballets like "Swan Lake," "The Nutcracker," and "Sleeping Beauty."
George Gershwin combined jazz and classical styles, and his piece "Rhapsody in Blue" became a symbol of American music.
John Williams composed many well-known movie themes, including music for "Star Wars," "Jurassic Park," and "Harry Potter."
